data.title: Buy the small portable device that saves NPR and public radio stories
data.meta_description: Purchase the Radio Bookmark through our online store.  The small, portable device that makes it simple to follow up on the NPR and public radio stories you don't want to forget.
data.text:
Radio Bookmark — The small portable device that makes it easy to follow up on the public radio stories you don't want to forget.

Purchase the Radio Bookmark

$39.95

Also available free with your station membership.

Features

Supported Stations

Reviews

Specifications

Features

The Radio Bookmark

An easy to use, small, portable device that makes it easy to follow up on the public radio stories and music you don't want to forget.

When you don't quite have time to finish listening to that great story or you want to share it with a friend… just push the button.

The Radio Bookmark creates your own personal web page of all the stories you bookmarked so you can listen again or email them to a friend.

How it works

When you push the button to bookmark a story or music you would like to follow up on, the Radio Bookmark just records the time of day and automatically matches your bookmarks with your station's program schedule.

Later, when convenient to you, plug it into your USB port of you PC or Mac and your own personal web page lists your "bookmarked" stories in an easy-to-read format.

Replay and email stories and find more information regarding the topic and other stories by the same author.

The Radio Bookmark has 2 buttons. These buttons can be configured to bookmark stories and music from two different supported public radio stations of your choice.

Learn More

Supported Stations

The Radio Bookmark is pre-configured for your favorite public radio station's program schedule and audio/web links. We have done our best to support most public radio stations, however individual programs may be supported differently depending on the content available. Please select your favorite public radio station and view the programs we support.

Programs listed in bold on the station schedule are completely supported with audio and web content. This includes national programs (such as the samples listed below) along with over 250 more national and local programs.

A Prairie Home Companion

All Things Considered

Bob Edwards Weekend

Car Talk

Fresh Air

From the Top

Marketplace

Morning Edition

Talk of the Nation

The Diane Rehm Show

The Splendid Table

The World

The Writer's Almanac

This American Life

Whad' Ya Know?

Select a Station:

Choose a station to view its schedule.

You can bookmark any program that is listed in the station's program schedule. Any program that is not bold may only have limited information available. Many music programs publish the audio and are available for replay. However there are also programs we cannot replay due to rights issues. In this case we will display the song title for the music bookmark if the playlist is published by the station, or in some instances, we will direct you to the playlist page if it is available.

If you have any specific questions about a local or national program, please drop us a note and we will respond with all the details.

For some programs, the information may not be available immediately after the program airs but is typically available within a few hours.

Reviews

“I recently renewed my pledge to KQED as I listen to your radio service frequently. I am writing to tell you that the Radio Bookmark you sent is more than a pleasant surprise, it is absolutely terrific!

The Radio Bookmark allows me to listen to many my favorite programs that I would have previously missed. In fact, I am now hearing and enjoying programs that I never heard before thanks to this device. The Radio Bookmark combines the best features of the radio and the computer allowing me to enjoy your great broadcasting on my schedule.

Please keep in mind that I never write letters like this; I'm just not one of those kind of guys. That is my way of telling you that the Radio Bookmark must really be something for me to do this!” - Patrick T., San Francisco, CA

“Thanks! This device is already enhancing my enjoyment of public radio.” - Michele G., Cincinnati, OH

“The Radio Bookmark is fabulous!! We love it!” - Lynn W., Cincinnati, OH

“I LOVE THE RADIO BOOKMARK! WOW!”- John F., West Lafayette, IN

Specifications

Capable of storing up to 128 bookmarks between uploads (when plugged into a computer, the bookmarks are transferred to your personal Radio Bookmark web page and the memory is cleared so another 128 bookmarks are available).

10 year battery life expected

Two buttons, each configurable for any of the supported public radio stations

PC and Mac compatible

Includes a convenient keychain ring and hook

Includes a quick start guide and complete online documentation
